section.name: 3. Tomcat Configuration
section.p: Jetspeed 2 now can use the Tomcat manager application for managing portlet applications through its new Portlet Application Lifecycle Manager Portlet. To be able to do so it needs a configured Tomcat user with the predefined 'manager' role in the ${CATALINA_HOME}/conf/tomcat-users.xml.

A minimal example tomcat-users.xml could look like:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?> <tomcat-users> <role rolename="manager"/> <user username="j2deployer" password="j2deployer" roles="manager"/> </tomcat-users>
Make sure to use a more appropriate username and password.
With the above example the required autodeployment properties should be set as:
org.apache.jetspeed.services.autodeployment.user=j2deployer org.apache.jetspeed.services.autodeployment.password=j2deployer
